summary: Almost a third of the food produced in the U.S. goes to waste. This includes food thrown out due to confusion over the date printed on its packaging (date labels). Manufacturers use a variety of labels such as "best by" or "enjoy by" to show how long food will have the best taste. However, consumers may falsely believe these are expiration labels and throw out...
title: Date Labels on Packaged Foods: USDA and FDA Could Take Additional Steps to Reduce Consumer Confusion
